description: Serving as a bridge between previous ELT coursework and actual, situated teaching, this course is designed to offer students an opportunity to observe, explore, and implement effective teaching ideas. It covers in-class micro-teaching, classroom observation, and practice teaching at a high school. The major activities in the first semester include analysis and discussion of teaching videos, visits to schools located in the Taipei area, and most importantly, in-class micro-teaching. For the micro-teaching, each student is required to write a lesson plan and then teach for 30 minutes, with all his/her classmates as students and observers. The micro-teaching is followed by a discussion session led by the instructor, with an aim to help improve students’ teaching techniques. To prepare students for the micro-teaching and practice teaching as well, a review of lesson planning and an introduction to procedures that may help teacher development are given at the beginning of the first semester. The second semester covers as its main activities visits to schools located outside the Taipei area, classroom observation, and practice teaching in a high school. In addition to work related to the micro-teaching and practice teaching, students are required to write various reports and participate in classroom discussion and evaluation. Outside the class, students need to study the assigned chapters in groups, brainstorm for its implications and write a one-page (or longer) reflection on each chapter.

*   **Course Description:**

English Teaching Practicum (II) is a hands-on practicum for pre-service English teachers in the English Department. It offers students a valuable opportunity to gain classroom experience, and to develop and apply their teaching ideas in a middle-school classroom. In this semester, several experienced English teachers will be invited to give a talk to share their teaching experience and discuss essential ELT issues in Taiwan. Apart from lectures, invited talks, group work and other in-class activities, students will also have classroom observations (2 weeks) and practice teaching (2 weeks) at a middle school.

*   **Delivery of Instruction:**

1.  Lecture
2.  Group work & discussion
3.  Student presentation
4.  Micro-teaching/practice teaching
5.  Classroom observation

*   **Grading Policy:**

1.  Middle school supervisor’s evaluation of your practicum performance – **20%**
2.  NTNU instructor’s evaluation of your practicum performance – **15%**
3.  Teaching portfolio (including lesson plans, classroom observations, peer observations, and self-reflection, reflection on middle school supervisors’ teaching) – **30%**
4.  Reflections on invited talks, school visit and practicum experience – **20****%**
5.  Attendance, assignments, and participation – **15%**

*   **Classroom Policies:**

1.  Class attendance is a fundamental requirement that will be strictly enforced in this course. Students are required to come to class or any group meeting on time. Absence from **each class period** will result in a 2.5-point deduction from the attendance/assignments/ participation grade (except for a valid excuse approved by the instructor). Absence from any group meeting will also seriously affect the final course grade. In addition, students’ participation will also be scored based on how much they contribute to discussions in class and during teacher-student conferences.
2.  Students are required to submit any of their assignments (e.g., lesson plans and reports) before it is due. Late assignments will be marked down by **30%**. Once they are two or more days late, they will NOT be accepted. 
3.  Dishonesty: Academic dishonesty is a misconduct that occurs in academic exercises. It involves plagiarism, cheating, fabrication, etc. Students will be penalized for academic dishonesty on any tests, assignments and exercises.

There is no set textbook for this course. Reading materials will be provided.

1.  **Teaching Portfolio (30%--****中學指導老師觀課心得報告****5%****＋其他****25%)**

Students are required to hand in an individual teaching portfolio that must include **at least** the following components:

1.  Table of contents
2.  A self-introduction that includes their curriculum vitae, photo, teaching philosophy, and a brief autobiography written in English and Chinese
3.  **At least 3 reports** on classroom observations (one report for one class period) in their middle school supervisor’s classes (5%)
4.  Lesson plans (original and revised drafts)
5.  One reflective report on their own practice teaching (試教心得一份)
6.  Peer observation reports (**3** reports per week; **6** reports in total): Students need to observe their classmates’ practice teaching for **at least 6 times (around 3 times per week)** and submit **at least 6 observation reports**. For each observation report, they need to prepare two copies, which will be documented in their own teaching portfolio and their classmates’, respectively. (上台教學期間，每週觀察至少**三**位同學的教學，並寫成心得回饋，每週**三**份，每份皆須有兩份影本，一份影本自己留存，另一份影本提供給授課同學放到教學檔案夾中)
7.  **In the portfolio, please present all of the documents “page by page” in an organized way.**

1.  **Guidelines and requirements for all practicum students:**

All practicum students must follow the guidelines and requirements for teaching practicum. Those who violate the guidelines and requirements will receive a 3-point deduction from the final course grade.
